Definitions.Paraphrase:
(of people) rather old; senior; past middle age
（指人）年龄相当大的；中年以上的
He's an elderly gentleman.
他是位年长的绅士。
He's very active for an elderly man. 
就已过中年的人来说，他的精力是很充沛的。

1. (of a person) fall down (and usu. become unconscious) because of illness, tiredness, etc.
（指人）病倒；累倒；昏倒	
He collapsed in the street and died on the way to the hospital. 
他突然昏倒在大街上，在被送往医院的路上死了。
A policeman collapsed from the smoke. 
一位警察被浓烟熏倒了。
2. break into pieces and fall down or in suddenly 
倒塌；塌陷
The whole building collapsed. 
整个大楼倒塌了。
The roof collapsed under the weight of the snow. 
屋顶被积雪压塌了。

1. the act of collapsing 
倒塌, 塌陷
The storm caused the collapse of the building. 
暴风雨使那幢建筑物倒塌了。
2. a sudden and complete loss of strength or will 
昏倒; 崩溃
He suffered from a collapse of the body after long days of hard work. 
由于许多天长时间的艰苦工作他累倒了。

a truck equipped to carry sick or hurt people to hospital, etc. 
救护车
The number of ambulances at Shanghai hospitals is very small. 
上海医院的救护车不多。

1. (in US and other countries) areas divided inside a state
（美国及其他国家）郡；县（州以下的行政区分）
County government is a body chosen to run a county. 
郡议会是选举出来管理郡的事务的。
2. the largest unit of local governments in Britain
（英国最大行政单位）郡
He lives in the county of Kent. 
他住在肯特郡。

1. discover the exact position or place of (sb./sth.) 
确定......的位置；找出......的位置
I'm trying to locate Mr. Smith. Do you know where he is? 
我正在寻找史密斯先生。你知道他在哪里吗？
Please locate the electric fault as soon as possible. 
请尽快确定电路故障的位置。
（尤用于被动语态）位于
set (sth.) in a place; place 
A new factory is to be located on this lot. 
新厂将建在这个地方。
The information office is located in the city center. 
问讯处位于市中心。

sudden serious event or situation requiring immediate steps to be taken
紧急事件；紧急情况
You should only use this door in an emergency. 
这个门只有在紧急情况下才能使用。
The government has declared a state of emergency. 
政府已宣布处于紧急状态。

a special room in hospitals where the doctors try to save the people who are in a state of life or death
(医院) 急诊室
The emergency-room is on the ground floor.
急诊室在一楼。

[C] a member of a group of soldiers trained to fight on land or sea 
海军陆战队的军官或士兵
His son joined the Marines last year. 
他的儿子去年参加了海军陆战队。

1. of, near, living in the sea
海里的, 海生的
Whales and seals are marine animals. 
鲸鱼和海豹是海生动物。
2. of ships and their goods and trade at sea 
海运的, 海事的
marine insurance 
海事保险
marine law 
海事法

1. clearly seen or understood; very clear 
明显的；显而易见的
Certain problems were apparent from the start.
有些问题从一开始就可以清楚看出。
It became apparent that she was going to die. 
显然她快死了。
2. seeming; unreal 
外表的；表面上的；假的
Her apparent lack of care made him even more nervous. 
她表面冷漠，这使他越发紧张不安。
Their wealth is more apparent than real. 
他们并不象表面显得那样富裕。

according to how something looks; as it seems 
外表上；表面上；看上去像
He had apparently escaped by buying a guard.
看上去他像是买通了看守逃跑的。
Apparently they're going to marry. 
他们像是正准备结婚。

military force made up of two or more divisions 
军（由两个或两个以上的师组成）
The 6th Army Corps had to draw back to a less open position.
陆军第六军必须撤到一个更隐蔽的地方。

[C] motor equipment such as a car, truck or cart used for carrying goods or passengers on land 
陆上交通工具、车辆
Motor vehicles are cars, buses, motor bikes, etc. 
机动车辆即汽车、公共汽车、摩托车等。
A space vehicle carries people into space. 
宇宙飞船载人上天。

(area of) low-lying wet land 
沼泽（地带）；湿地
We had to cross the marshes. 
我们不得不穿过沼泽地带。

of or for soldiers or an army; of or for (all the) armed forces
军人的；军用的；陆军的；军事的；军队的
Military training is required for every student. 
每一位学生都要军训。
His son has been called up for military service. 
他的儿子被征召去服兵役去了。

1. one and only; single 
惟一的；独一无二的；仅有的
He is the sole one remaining after the accident. 
他是这次空难惟一幸存的人。
2. belonging to or limited to one person or group; not shared
（某人或某公司）专用的；独占的；不公用的
We have the sole right to sell this chain of goods. 
我们有独家出售这一系列货物的权利。

1. make (sb.) able to do sth. by giving him the  necessary power or means
（通过授予必要的权利和手段）使能够；使可以
This pass enables me to travel half-price on trains. 
这张通行证使我能够以半价乘火车旅行。
A dog's ears enable it to hear the least sound. 
狗的耳朵使它能听到极细微的声音。
2. make (sth.) possible 
使成为可能
The meeting will enable more international working together. 
这次会议将能促进更大的国际合作。

[U] time after twilight and before night 
黄昏；薄暮
The street lights come on at dusk and go off at dawn. 
黄昏时路灯亮起来，拂晓时熄灭。

an outer room, entrance-hall or room before main room(s)  
门廊；门厅；接待室
Let's meet at the lobby of the Hilton Hotel. 
我们在希尔顿酒店的大厅碰头。

1. (of the eyes, eyesight) not able to see well
（指眼睛、视力）看不清楚的
His sight is getting dim.
他的视力越来越模糊了。
Her eyes are dim with tears.
她泪眼朦胧。
2. where or which one cannot see well; not bright 
微暗的；朦胧的
This is a dim hall with no windows. 
这是一个没有窗户的幽暗的大厅。
Don't read by dim candle-light. 
别在暗淡的烛光下看书。

in a dim way 
模糊地；朦胧地
I can only see dimly the edges of the building on a dark night. 
黑夜中，只能依稀可见建筑物的轮廓。
This is a dimly lit room. 
这是一个灯光昏暗的房间。

[U] chemical element, a gas without color, taste or smell, present in the air and necessary for all forms of life on earth
氧；氧气
There was a lack of oxygen at the top of the mountain. 
山顶上缺氧。
She died from lack of oxygen.
她因缺氧而死。

1. lay or move out (the body or a limb) at  full length
伸开；展开（身体或四肢）
He extended his hand to the new worker. 
他伸手同新雇员握手。
The athlete extended her arms out sideways. 
体操运动员平伸双臂。
2. make sth. longer or larger (in space or time) 
使（在空间或时间上）伸展；扩大；加大
Can you extend your visit a few days longer? 
你能多停留几天吗？
Could you please extend the credit for me? 
能为我延长信贷期限吗？

1. lacking strength or energy
无力的；没精神的
He gave me a limp handshake.
他的握手软弱无力。
The flowers looked limp in the heat. 
花在热天显得很蔫。
2. not straight or firm
柔软的；软弱的
This book only comes in a limp cover.
这本书只有平装本。
This young man is wearing a limp grey sweater. 
这个年轻人穿着一件柔软的灰色运动衫。

walk with a halting step, one foot or leg moving less well than the other 
一瘸一拐地走
He hurt his foot and limped to the door of the classroom. 
他伤了脚, 一瘸一拐地走到教室门口。

1. press on (sth.) from opposite sides or all sides 
压；挤；榨；紧握
To squeeze one's hand is a sign of liking or sympathy, etc.
紧握某人的手是一种爱慕或同情的表示。
The company was squeezed by the reduced sales. 
这家公司由于销售减少而处于财政困难压力之下。
2. force (oneself/sb./sth.) into, through, etc. a narrow gap or limited space 
用力使进入（通过）狭窄或有限的空间；挤入；挤过
There were already four people in the lift, but he managed to squeeze in. 
电梯里已经有了四个人，但他还是设法挤了进去。
She squeezed as many books onto the shelf as she could. 
她把尽可能多的书放上书架。

1. a separate part or room for a particular group of patients 
病房
This is a single ward.
这是私人病房。
2. a person, esp. a child, who is under the care of a guardian or the defense of a law court
 (尤指小孩)受监护人；受保护人
The child was made a ward of the court. 
那个小孩儿成了受法院直接监护的人。
She invested the money for her ward. 
她代表受她监护的人将钱做了投资。

1. happening, coming, done, etc., from time to time; not regular
偶尔的；偶然的；不经常的
He pays me occasional visits. 
他偶尔来看我。
I drink an occasional cup of coffee; but usually I take tea. 
我偶尔喝杯咖啡；但通常喝茶。
2. used, meant, written, etc. for a special event 
应时的、应景的
The occasional poem was written to celebrate the revolution. 
这首应景诗是为庆祝革命而作的。
The musician was busy with occasional music for the royal wedding. 
音乐家正在为皇家婚礼谱写乐曲。

now and then; at times 
偶然地；有时
He visits me occasionally.
他偶尔来看我。

1.（盛液体或气体的）大容器；大箱；大罐
Water is stored in tanks under the roof. 
水储存在屋顶下的水罐里。
Every car has got a gas tank. 
每辆车都有一个油箱。
2.坦克
He is a tank commander. 
他是个坦克指挥官。

[U] act, sound or way of laughing 
笑；笑声
The house is full of laughter. 
这所房子充满了笑声。
They rolled with laughter. 
他们哄然大笑。

1. a group of assistants working together in a business, etc. answering to a manager or person in charge 
工作人员
I have a staff of ten. 
我有10名员工。
We need more staff in the office. 
我们办公室需要更多的工作人员。
掌权的人；做管理工作的人（与学生和工人相对）
This group is made up of a head teacher and her staff. 
小组成员由一位教师负责人和她的教员组成。
The school staff are expected to watch over school meals. 
学校的教职员应监督学校的膳食。

1. give sth. and receive sth. (from another person) in return 
交换；互换；交流
They exchanged glances. 
他们互相使眼色。
The two men exchanged blows. 
两个人打架。
2. give or receive sth./sb. (of the same kind or value) in place of another 
交换
He exchanged the blue shirt for a red one. 
他把蓝色的短上衣换成了一件红的。
The enemy countries exchanged prisoners. 
敌对国家交换了战俘。

1. (of, about) give sb. knowledge (of sth.); tell sb. 
通知；告诉；报告
Keep me informed about what happens. 
随时向我报告情况。
He informed the police that some money was missing. 
他通知警方有些钱不见了。
2. (0n) give evidence or make a charge against sb. (to the police)
控告
One of the prisoners informed on the rest of his group. 
一个罪犯告发了犯罪团伙的其他成员。

(ability for) sharing the feelings of others; feeling of pity and sadness (for sb.) 
同情；怜悯
She never expressed any sympathy when I was hurt. 
我受伤时，她从来没表示过任何同情。
Out of sympathy for the homeless children he gave them a bed for the night. 
出于对无家可归的孩子们的怜悯，他让他们留宿过夜。

1. stop (sb.) from speaking, etc., or (sth.) from happening by speaking oneself or by causing some other sort of trouble 
打扰（通过插话或其他形式的干扰，打断某人的谈话或其他正在发生的事情。）
Don't interrupt the speaker now; he will answer questions later. 
现在不要打断演讲人的话，过一会儿他 将回答问题。
Don't interrupt me while I'm busy! 
在我忙着的时候，不要打扰我！
2. break the flow (of sth.)  for a period of time 
使中断
Trade between the two countries was interrupted by the war.
战争使两国间的贸易中断了。
We interrupt this program to bring you a news flash. 
我们中断这个节目，给您插播一条新闻电讯。

give a sudden shock or surprise to (a person or an animal); cause to move or jump suddenly (from surprise) 
使大吃一惊；使惊跳起来
I was startled to hear his news. 
听到他的消息我大吃一惊。
The sudden noise in the bushes startled her horse. 
灌木丛中突然发出的怪声使她的马惊跳起来。

to go out; (esp. of an actor) leave (the stage) 
退出；（尤指演员）退场
We exited from the party as soon as we could. 
我们尽快退出了聚会场所。
At the end of the third scene the actress exits. 
第三幕结束时，那位女演员退场。

[C] a way out 
出口
How many exits are there from the cinema? 
这家电影院有多少出口处？

(usu. faith based) a form of burying or burning dead people
葬礼（土葬或火葬）
When is his funeral? 
他的葬礼何时举行？
A funeral march is a sad and serious piece of music suitable for funerals. 
葬礼进行曲是适合于葬礼的一种悲伤、庄严的音乐。

1. a department in a firm which deals with workers, esp. with their hiring and benefits 
人事部门；人事处
Personnel is organizing the training of the new members of staff. 
人事处正在组织对新职员的培训。
2. people employed in one of the armed forces, a firm or a public office; staff 
职员；人员（指军职、公司或公职人员）
Army personnel are not allowed to leave the base. 
军事人员不许擅离基地。
Airline personnel can buy flight tickets at reduced prices. 
航空公司职工可以减价购买飞机票。

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
recover consciousness 
苏醒, 恢复知觉
I came to in the hospital, but I didn't remember what had happened to me. 
我在医院里醒了过来, 却不记得发生了什么事。

sometimes 
不时地, 有时候
We do meet now and again, but not regularly. 
我们有时候确实见面, 但不是定期会面。

demand; ask for 
要求
The relatives and friends of the dead man called for an investigation. 
死者的亲友要求调查。

begin a journey 
出发
They set out for London on a one-day trip. 
他们出发去伦敦一日游。

for a period of time; for some time
一会儿；有一段时间
Just wait for a while and then I'll help you. 
请稍候, 等一会我来帮你。

take no notice of 
不注意, 没加注意
The boy failed in the examination because he had paid no attention to the teacher in class. 
那男孩考试没及格, 他上课不听老师讲课。

at times; sometimes 
不时地, 有时候, 时时
She meets her old boyfriend for a drink now and then. 
她不时见一次前男友, 喝上一杯。

after doing that 
接着, 于是
She threw the book  on the table, and with that ran angrily out of the room. 
她 "砰" 一下把书丢在桌子上, 生气地走出房间。

in the course of the journey that one is making somewhere 
在路上
Lynn was on her way home when she was hit by a car. 
在回家路上, 利恩被车撞了。

happen to be; be found to be in the end 
结果是, 证明是
The film turned out to be a great success. 
这部影片结果大获成功。
It turned out that his statement was false. 
他这番话后来证明是虚假的。
